postsData.name:
Dan Goodman
Dan Goodman
postsData.content:
Don't play your hand before it's time. 

Don’t talk about FMLA with your employer until you have all the paperwork and approvals all set.

I have heard countless stories of employees mentioning that they were considering going on FMLA with their manager or inquiring about it with HR to find themselves terminated within days.

The last person you want to tell is your employer. Literally. Research it, learn all about it. Find out what your options and rights are. Get it all set up and ready to go and then drop it on your employer before they can pull the rug out from under you.

I have heard from more than 30 people who have experienced this. Opening up with their manager “friend” or HR business “partner” to then have that information used against them.

Share as little as possible for as long as possible and when the time comes, make sure you can’t be blindsided by your employer’s reaction.

p.s. HR trolls, I am not suggesting fraud. I am not suggesting people take advantage of medical leave. I am not suggesting anything lacking character, integrity, or that will impact employees future job prospects. These benefits and rights exist and it is the employees right to utilize them when appropriate to do so. Even if it screws up your plans to terminate them.

comments.commentText:
Great advice. I had been employed in the finance department of a University for several years when my blind and disabled mother required several surgeries. I became her primary caregiver. My PTO that year depleted quickly.

I was incredibly fortunate that Jolene, my manager at Wake Forest University, suggested I look into Intermittent FMLA. I was able to take unpaid time off to care for my mom without fearing I’d lose my job. I was very lucky, thankful, grateful, etc. to have such a caring and empathetic manager. I felt valued, if that makes sense.

There ARE a handful of employers out there who value their employees. Those employers are hard to find these days.

It is unfortunate that many employers lack human decency and empathy. Employees to them are not human beings, but only cogs in a wheel that can easily be replaced.

Wow!! This it home for me. I took the last of my vacation for a family emergency. Needed to extend. My HR mentioned to me that I need to go on FMLA which I did. Had to go back the following month to attend to my family. Upon my return on the first of the month I was told my position was being eliminated do to restructuring. Proceeded to tell me they are creating a newer positron. I’m currently dealing with this issue. Frustrated!! I’m being positive about it all. I will prevail. I know my worth and they didn’t deserve me.
On to better things!!

postsData.commentAdded: Wise advice! Knowledge is power—ensure youre fully prepared before discussing FMLA with your employer. Protect your rights!

postsData.name:
Shail Khiyara
Shail Khiyara
postsData.content:
𝗛𝗼𝗹𝗹𝘆𝘄𝗼𝗼𝗱 𝘀𝗮𝗶𝗱 𝗻𝗼. 𝗧𝗿𝗮𝗱𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘀𝗮𝗶𝗱 𝗻𝗼. 
𝗕𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗲 𝗟𝗲𝗲 𝘀𝗮𝗶𝗱, ‘𝗪𝗮𝘁𝗰𝗵 𝗺𝗲'.

𝘞𝘦𝘭𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘸𝘦𝘦𝘬’𝘴
—𝘢 𝘴𝘵𝘰𝘳𝘺 𝘵𝘰 𝘪𝘨𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘦 𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘸𝘦𝘦𝘬 𝘢𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘥.

Bruce Lee wasn’t just a martial artist or a movie star—he was a visionary who redefined success.

As a boy in Hong Kong, Bruce was attacked by a gang. That moment could have left him broken, but instead, it ignited his lifelong pursuit of martial arts. 𝗬𝗲𝘁 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝗻 𝗺𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘆, 𝗵𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱 𝗹𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀. Traditional styles felt rigid and impractical.

What many dont know is that Bruce had physical limitations: one leg was an inch shorter and his eyesight was minus 10. Yet he practiced relentlessly, throwing 5,000 punches a day.

So, he did what few dared: he created his own. 𝗛𝗶𝘀 𝗽𝗵𝗶𝗹𝗼𝘀𝗼𝗽𝗵𝘆, 𝗝𝗲𝗲𝘁 𝗞𝘂𝗻𝗲 𝗗𝗼, 𝘄𝗮𝘀𝗻’𝘁 𝗷𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗳𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴—𝗶𝘁 𝘄𝗮𝘀 𝗮 𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗱𝘀𝗲𝘁.

"𝘈𝘣𝘴𝘰𝘳𝘣 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘴 𝘶𝘴𝘦𝘧𝘶𝘭, 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘥 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘴 𝘯𝘰𝘵, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘥𝘥 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘴 𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘲𝘶𝘦𝘭𝘺 𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘰𝘸𝘯."

Bruce wasn’t just about physical power—𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗮𝘀 𝗮 𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗲𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗲𝗿, 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗮 𝗹𝗶𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝗼𝗳 𝟮,𝟱𝟬𝟬 𝗯𝗼𝗼𝗸𝘀 on philosophy, psychology & self-improvement, believing true mastery united body and mind.

𝗛𝗼𝗹𝗹𝘆𝘄𝗼𝗼𝗱 presented its own fight. As an Asian actor, Bruce was sidelined as “exotic” or typecast. 𝗗𝗼𝗼𝗿𝘀 𝗱𝗶𝗱𝗻’𝘁 𝗷𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘆 𝘀𝗵𝘂𝘁—𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘆 𝘄𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝗹𝗼𝗰𝗸𝗲𝗱.

Instead of waiting for permission to succeed, Bruce flowed around the obstacles. He choreographed, directed, and redefined what it meant to be an Asian actor in films like The Big Boss and Enter the Dragon. His "Be like water" philosophy wasn’t just words—it was action.

“𝘞𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘥𝘰𝘦𝘴𝘯’𝘵 𝘧𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵 𝘰𝘣𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘤𝘭𝘦𝘴; 𝘪𝘵 𝘧𝘭𝘰𝘸𝘴 𝘢𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘮, 𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘩𝘢𝘱𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘵𝘩 𝘢𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘥.”

The world that once rejected him now honors him with statues, recognition in 𝗧𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝗠𝗮𝗴𝗮𝘇𝗶𝗻𝗲’𝘀 “𝟭𝟬𝟬 𝗠𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗜𝗻𝗳𝗹𝘂𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗣𝗲𝗼𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝟮𝟬𝘁𝗵 𝗖𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘂𝗿𝘆,” and a legacy that inspires millions.

 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗟𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗼𝗻: When traditional methods don’t work for you, challenge them. Like Bruce’s Jeet Kune Do, greatness comes from rethinking the rules and adding what’s uniquely yours.

𝗦𝗼, 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁’𝘀 𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗱𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, 𝗿𝘂𝗹𝗲, 𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝘆𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗺 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝘃𝗲 𝗮𝗰𝗰𝗲𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻? 𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗲 𝗶𝘁 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗼 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘂𝗻𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲𝗹𝘆 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗼𝘄𝗻?

Bruce Lee’s story isn’t just about what he overcame—it’s about how he adapted, innovated, and created a legacy.

𝗪𝗛𝗔𝗧'𝘀 𝗬𝗢𝗨𝗥 𝗝𝗘𝗘𝗧 𝗞𝗨𝗡𝗘 𝗗𝗢 - 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗨𝗡𝗜𝗤𝗨𝗘 𝗣𝗔𝗧𝗛 𝗢𝗡𝗟𝗬 𝗬𝗢𝗨 𝗖𝗔𝗡 𝗖𝗥𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗘?
Like Bruce, we all have the power to redefine what’s possible.

‍

comments.commentText: I grew up in Singapore where he was idolized. A counter culture brand that stood for not being Western. We thought the Green Hornet was the Bruce Lee Show. I believe corporate innovation can learn a lot from his approach. Instead we see many innovators thinking that following instructions will satisfy the status quo. That’s why the average span of a corporate innovator is 3.5 years. It’s about you not the environment.
Mohan, thank you for sharing your experience & insights.

postsData.commentAdded: Bruce Lees journey is a powerful reminder to challenge norms and transform limitations into unique strengths. Whats your Jeet Kune Do moment?

postsData.name:
Kiran Babu
Kiran Babu
postsData.content:
Common Career Trap: Choose Growth Over Glamour

Ever feel like you landed the “right” role… but in the wrong company?

It’s the quickest way to crush your ambition, sap your passion, and drain your energy.

On the other side, the “wrong” role in the right company?
That could turn into the opportunity of your dreams.

Here’s the hard truth:
The perfect job isn’t about the paychecks, perks, or bonuses.
It’s about finding the right company—and you’ve probably learned this lesson the hard way.

The right company means:
- A people-first, growth-oriented culture.
- Leaders who respect your boundaries.
- A workplace that prioritizes mental well-being.
- A system built on trust, recognition, and real career growth.

Beware of these red flags:
- Blame games and gossip-heavy environments.
- Hypocritical leaders who talk the talk but don’t walk the walk.
- Unrealistic expectations that leave you burned out.
- A lack of genuine recognition or support for mental health.
- Toxic “high performers” rewarded at the expense of others.

Perks are nice. Culture is everything.

Why? Because thriving at work is about the long game.
It’s about waking up excited, not dragging yourself to a toxic workplace.

No paycheck is worth sacrificing your peace of mind.

It’s better to have a job that doesn’t fit your dream title but nourishes your growth, than to wear a “dream title” that fills your life with toxicity.

Fulfillment. Growth. Well-being. That’s what truly matters.

Choosing your growth isn’t selfish—it’s essential. It’s how you unlock the best version of yourself.

You absolutely deserve that version of YOU.

comments.commentText: One thing I’d add is how important autonomy is. The best companies trust you to do your job without micromanaging, which boosts both confidence and creativity.

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Prioritizing growth over glamour is key. A supportive culture fosters true success and fulfillment. Well said! 🌟

𝗗𝗼 𝗬𝗼𝘂 𝗗𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗺 𝗼𝗳 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗯𝘂𝘁 𝗙𝗲𝗲𝗹 𝗢𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗺𝗲𝗱?

Alex is passionate about growing the business and empowering their team.

But lately, things have felt chaotic.

Deadlines keep slipping. Meetings drag on.

And despite long hours, the big-picture goals seem further away than ever.

Last week, after yet another day of firefighting, Alex sat back and thought:

"Why can’t I lead with clarity and focus like the leaders I admire? What am I missing?"

The truth? Leadership isn’t about working harder. It’s about working smarter.

It’s about having clear priorities, scalable systems, and the confidence to lead with purpose.

Does this sound like your story?

Are you ready to take your leadership to the next level?

⭐ Lead with confidence and clarity

postsData.name:
Chitra Lele—Spirit-Tech Synergist
Chitra Lele—Spirit-Tech Synergist
postsData.content:
A Journey of Joy by Chitra Lele—Spirit-Tech Synergist 
---by Chitra

A circle of friends, cheerful and free,
Singing loud in harmony.
Feet find the rhythm as the journey flows
And seats transform into a stage for dancing shows.

The road unfolds while the fresh air is a treat.
Along the way, there are crunching wafers and chicken to eat.
The sugarcane juice, refreshing and sweet
And each sip fuels laughter– oh, what a joyful treat!

Mother Nature sings gently as the crops rise high.
In Her embrace, we reach for the sky.
Through fields of green and farms so wide,
We walk in sync, side by side.

Chocolate melts as jokes take flight.
Our sticky fingers are pure delight.
As the road back home bends, the sun with the brush of its glorious glow
Paints our friendship canvas with a golden glow.

In nature's embrace, where spirits fly,
We all belong beneath the vast sky.
From golden crops to skies so blue,
A journey of joy where dreams come true.

With

comments.commentText:
#friends 
#smile Chitra Lele—Spirit-Tech Synergist

postsData.commentAdded: What a beautiful celebration of friendship and nature! 🎉 Your poetic journey truly captures the essence of joy and connection. Thank you for sharing!

postsData.name:
Shraddha Shah
Shraddha Shah
postsData.content:
Insights from Women-Led Businesses: A Memorable Event 

Yesterday, I had the privilege of moderating an inspiring panel discussion on "Insights from Women-Led Businesses" at Provyz Coworking, Vesu. Sharing the stage with such talented women entrepreneurs was a humbling experience.

Singhal (Zoivane Pets) – Making pets a priority with unique care products.
Singh (CrmOne) – Transforming businesses through CRM solutions.
Kaur (Green Closet) – Championing sustainability with style.
(Maiora Diamonds) – Setting new standards in the diamond industries

The session was filled with invaluable insights, from overcoming challenges to creating meaningful impact through innovative solutions.

Key takeaways:
 Resilience and adaptability are the keys to success.
 Building a community and network accelerates growth.
 Every challenge is an opportunity to innovate and inspire.

I’m grateful to,, and,for organizing this platform to celebrate women entrepreneurs and their journeys. Let’s continue supporting and uplifting each other to create a thriving ecosystem for women in business.

comments.commentText: Shraddha Shah amazing to see your participation in such an event.

postsData.commentAdded: What a fantastic initiative! Celebrating women entrepreneurs and their insights is essential for fostering innovation and collaboration. Thank you for sharing!

postsData.name:
Andrew Bolis
Andrew Bolis
postsData.content:
Copy & paste these ChatGPT prompts to write a standout Resume/CV 

Highlight your best skills. Get more interview calls. Land dream jobs!

Use these 10 powerful ChatGPT prompts:


 Prompt 1: ATS-Friendly Resume Architect

Create an ATS-optimized resume structure for my [Job Title] application. Suggest section order, formatting tips, and 10 industry-specific keywords to incorporate. Provide a checklist for ATS compatibility. Present as a template with annotations. My current resume: [Paste Resume]. Job description: [Paste Job Description].


 Prompt 2: Impact-Driven Achievement Formatter

Transform 5 of my job responsibilities into powerful achievement statements for [Most Recent Job]. Use the CAR (Context-Action-Result) method and quantify results. Provide before/after examples in a table format. Include an "impact score" for each bullet. My resume: [Paste Resume].


 Prompt 3: Executive Summary Crafting Guide

Write a compelling 3-4 sentence professional summary for my [Job Title] resume. Highlight my unique value proposition and key skills. Create 3 versions: experience-focused, skills-focused, and goals-oriented. Limit each to 50 words. Provide a "relevance rating" for each. My resume: [Paste Resume].


 Prompt 4: Strategic Skills Section Builder

Analyze required skills for my target [Job Title]. Create an optimized skills section with hard, soft, and technical skills. Rank skills by relevance. Suggest top 3 skills to acquire or improve. Include a "skills match percentage" with job requirements. My resume: [Paste Resume]. Job requirements: [Paste Requirements].


 Prompt 5: Leadership Experience Showcase

Highlight my leadership experience for [Target Role]. Create 3 impactful bullet points under 20 words each. Focus on team size, project scope, and measurable results. Include leadership-specific action verbs. Provide a "leadership impact score" for each point. My resume: [Paste Resume].


 Prompt 6: Cross-Industry Skill Translator

Identify 5 transferable skills from my [Current Industry] to [Target Industry]. Reframe each skill for the new context. Provide industry-specific examples for each. Create a "skill transferability index". My resume: [Paste Resume]. Target job: [Target Job Description].


 Prompt 7: Education Section Relevance Booster

Optimize my education section for [Job Title]. Highlight relevant coursework, projects, and academic achievements. Suggest education section placement based on my career stage. Provide a format for showcasing ongoing education. Include a "relevance score" for each item. My resume: [Paste Resume].


⭐ Find prompts 8, 9 & 10 in comments

- - -

 Get free PDF guide “15 ChatGPT Resume Writing Secrets”:

 Follow mefor AI career tips

 REPOST to help other job seekers

comments.commentText:
BONUS PROMPTS: Optimize Resume/CV 

 Prompt 8: Career Gap Positive Framing Strategy

Develop a strategy to positively frame my [X-month/year] career gap. Suggest relevant activities or skills gained during this time. Provide a brief resume explanation and longer interview talking points. Include a "growth demonstration score". My career gap details: [Career Gap Information].

 Prompt 9: Versatile Resume Template Designer

Create a flexible resume template for my applications in [Industry 1] and [Industry 2]. Identify core and variable sections. Suggest industry-specific language for each. Include a customization checklist and version tracking system. My resume: [Paste Resume]. Target industries: [Industry 1], [Industry 2].

 Prompt 10: Project Impact Maximizer

Identify my 3 most relevant projects for [Target Job]. Create concise, impactful descriptions emphasizing outcomes and skills used. Suggest strategic placement within the resume. Include a "project relevance rating" for the target job. My resume: [Paste Resume]. Job description: [Paste Job Description].

postsData.commentAdded: These prompts are a game-changer! Excited to revamp my resume for better opportunities. Thanks for sharing these valuable tools! 🚀

postsData.name:
Emma Lo
Emma Lo
postsData.content:
Every battle starts with the basics. ️


Swords. Battles. Striking first.

That’s why my kids fell in love with fencing.

But their first lesson?
It wasn’t duels—it was 90% footwork.

Weeks later, they’re still practicing the basics:

Stand. Step. Hold. Repeat.

——————-

Last week at thebook club, we dove into a key principle from Steven Pressfield’s The War of Art:

Mastery doesn’t come from big leaps.

It comes from showing up, doing the work, and winning small battles—day after day.


The lesson?

Keep practicing.
Win one step at a time.

Touché. 

P.S. What’s one small battle you’ve won today?

postsData.name:
Ronen Olshansky
Ronen Olshansky
postsData.content:
Lesley used to block time for networking.

Then spend that time dreading it.

She thought she was "reasonably good" at building connections.

But she hated every minute.

Our program changed that completely.

Those same one-hour networking sessions?

They became the highlight of her day.

The secret wasn't learning more tactics.

It was discovering a deeper approach to connection.

She learned that people are "wormholes" to opportunity.

But only when you drop the pretense and connect genuinely.

The change in her mindset was dramatic.

She started telling people: "Whatever you need, just tell me. I got you"

And she meant it.

Her story shows something powerful:

Networking doesn't have to be painful.

With the right approach, it becomes joyful.

That's not just better for your career — it's better for your life.

Today, Lesley doesn't just network.

She creates opportunities for others while enjoying every minute of it.

That's what happens when you learn to connect authentically.

You don't just get better at networking.

You start looking forward to it.

comments.commentText: Inspiring story Ronen Olshansky

postsData.commentAdded: Inspiring transformation, Lesley! Embracing authenticity in networking truly opens doors and enriches lives. Cheers to genuine connections! 🌟

postsData.name:
Marc Mawhinney
Marc Mawhinney
postsData.content:
When I started my coaching business, I had to do it on a shoestring (or dental floss) budget. 

It was a few years after a business closure and I didn't have the money to hire expensive web designers, copywriters, funnel ninjas ...

And I definitely didn't have money for ads!

At first I thought this was a huge disadvantage, as I watched others in the coaching space able to throw money at that stuff.

However, looking back over a decade later, I realize that my lack of resources starting out was actually an advantage and a silver lining:

First, it made me more motivated to get my business rolling, as I didn't have the luxury to sit back and wait. Nothing like the whole "burn the ships" strategy to light a fire under you!

But more importantly, since I couldn't hire help it forced me to roll up my sleeves and do everything myself.

I had to be disciplined, and I got used to writing/creating content every day. And with practice I got more clear on my message and what I wanted my business to be about.

I mention this to give encouragement to you if you're in the position I was once in and can't afford to throw boatloads of money hiring help or into ads.

My method in growing a coaching business is effective and it's been tested in the field over many years ...

But full disclosure: it does require work!

Details in the comments:

comments.commentText: www.nbcprogram.com

postsData.commentAdded: Incredibly inspiring! Your journey shows that determination and discipline can turn limitations into powerful opportunities for growth. 💪✨

postsData.name:
Namrata .
Namrata .
postsData.content:
learn more = Earn more

Welcome to the Ep-7 of "Cringe Chronicles"

By Namrata

They say knowledge is power, and it’s also your biggest flex,right?!.

The more you know, the better you get, and in writing, that knowledge translates to skill, opportunities, and, yeah, even money.


Why tf Learning Matters?

Better Writing, Better Pay. The more you improve, the more people notice your work.

And noticed work? That’s where the money’s at.

Keeps You Relevant.Trends change, styles evolve, if you’re not learning, you’re falling behind, for real.

Boosts Confidence. Knowing your stuff makes you feel like you belong. Confidence = better output.

But How to Keep Learning???

1. Read Everything. From novels to blogs, read widely.

It’s the easiest way to pick up new ideas and techniques.


2.Experiment. Try new genres, styles, or formats.

You learn the most when you step out of your comfort zone.


3.Take Feedback Seriously.

Criticism helps you see blind spots you didn’t know were there.


4.And lastly just Stay Curious Man. Keep asking, "How can I do this better?"

That mindset is what takes you places.


The Payoff

Learning more doesn’t just level up your writing it opens doors.

Whether it’s new gigs, publishing opportunities, or

just writing something you’re proud of, the effort is always worth it.


Yea Remember, the more you invest in yourself, the more it pays off.

So, keep learning, keep growing, and watch how it changes the game for you.

comments.commentText:
Learning is the one game that helps you beat all the levels!

Great series:))

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely, Namrata! Your insights on continuous learning are spot on. Investing in knowledge truly yields priceless returns. Keep inspiring! 📚✨

postsData.name:
Michael Ocean
Michael Ocean
postsData.content:
Why we're building our way, not the VC way.


The conventional wisdom is clear: chase unicorn status, raise massive rounds, and grow at all costs. But this playbook has founders obsessing over valuations instead of creating real value.


Why we're bootstrapping:

- Freedom to choose clients who share our values
- Team can work from anywhere in the world
- Time to understand each client deeply
- Flexibility to customize solutions
- Focus on impact, not standardization
- Building at our own pace


What I believe truly matters:

- Happy clients who stay longer and bring friends
- Small teams doing big things
- Money in the bank, not promises on paper
- People who love their work, not just their stock options
- Real solutions, not quick fixes
- Work that fits life, not the other way around

We decided to pick success by choice, not by pressure!


P.S. Buenos Aires 🇦🇷 just became our new HQ - Super fun place to be! Next is Medellín 🇨🇴 in a couple of months!

comments.commentText: Great choice Michael! I’ve been part of both VC and bootstrapped start ups. While inherently one is not necessarily better or worse to the other, you’ve given yourself and all your stakeholders the freedom that I so valued when making customer related decisions that just felt right.

postsData.commentAdded: Love this approach! Prioritizing value creation over valuation truly fosters authentic growth and meaningful client relationships. 🚀✨

postsData.name:
Helen Yu
Helen Yu
postsData.content:
Did you know AI can solve a Rubik's Cube faster than human? 

While this video shows a 26-second solve, the world record for a human is 3.13 seconds! And AI takes it to another level—Mitsubishi's TOKUFASTbot solved one in just 0.305 seconds!  Even deep learning algorithms like DeepCubeA can crack the puzzle in a fraction of a second.

Solving a Rubik's Cube has always been one of my favorite childhood memories! AI solving a Rubik’s Cube faster than us—cool, or a little unsettling?

I love how you tied this back to childhood memories; it’s incredible to see how far we’ve come, from twisting cubes with our hands to machines cracking them in the blink of an eye. AI keeps setting the bar higher, and your posts always remind us how thrilling this tech journey is!

The destination may provide satisfaction, but it’s the path that shapes who we are and gives us stories to cherish forever. As they say, "The journey is the reward."
